stageMetadata.title: Thinking Inside the Box - Creative Constraints
learningObjectives: Understand how constraints boost creativity (The 'Blank Page' Problem)
Learn to use negative constraints (What NOT to do)
Explore bounded creativity for better results

theorySection.explanation: It sounds contradictory, but AI is *more* creative when you give it limits. If you say 'Write a story', you might get a generic fairy tale. If you say 'Write a story using exactly 50 words about a robot who loves tea, without using the letter E', you get something unique. This is 'Bounded Creativity'. Stage 4 is about learning to use constraintsâ€”both positive (do this) and negative (do NOT do this)â€”to force the AI out of its boring, average habits.
keyPrinciples: **The Blank Page Paradox**: Total freedom often leads to average results. Constraints force the AI to search deeper in its neural network for solutions.
**Negative Constraints**: Telling the AI what *not* to include (e.g., 'no jargon', 'no ethical lectures', 'no intro text') is as important as what to include.
**Hard Limits**: Strict rules like word counts ('under 280 characters') or format limits ('start every sentence with S') are excellent for testing AI capability.
commonMistakes: Being vague about limits (e.g., 'make it short' vs 'under 50 words').
Over-constraining to the point of impossibility (e.g., 'write a novel in 1 word').
Forgetting to check if the AI actually followed the negative constraints (they sometimes struggle with 'not').

workedExamples.badPrompt: Write a short poem about winter.
workedExamples.goodPrompt: Write a Haiku about winter. Constraint: It must not use the word 'snow' or 'cold'.
workedExamples.explanation: The bad prompt invites clichÃ©s. The good prompt forces the AI to find new imagery (frost, ice, breath, white) to describe winter without the obvious words.
workedExamples.expectedOutputPreview:
Breath hangs in the air,
Crystal branches touch the sky,
Silence blankets all.

workedExamples.goodPrompt: Generate a business idea that combines 'Gardening' and 'Virtual Reality'. Constraint: It must be a subscription service under Â£10/month.
workedExamples.explanation: Random ideas are usually bad. By constraining the domains (Gardening + VR) and the business model (Subscription < Â£10), you force a specific, novel combination.
workedExamples.expectedOutputPreview: **VR Bloom**: A Â£9.99/month app where you design your dream garden in VR, and we send you the actual seeds for the plants you chose every season.

workedExamples.goodPrompt: Summarise the text below using exactly 10 words. Do not use any verbs.
workedExamples.explanation: This extreme constraint turns a summary task into a word puzzle, forcing the AI to distil the absolute essence of the text into a noun-heavy string.
workedExamples.expectedOutputPreview: Revolutionary new solar panels: higher efficiency, lower cost, unlimited power.

interactiveExercises.title: The Word Diet
interactiveExercises.scenario: Twitter limit? Too easy. Try this.
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Write a prompt that asks the AI to explain 'Gravity' using exactly 15 words.
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Explain the concept of gravity using exactly 15 words. Do not use more or less.

feedbackHints.noCount: You must specify the number '15' words.
feedbackHints.perfect: Precision is power. The AI will count carefully.

interactiveExercises.title: The Forbidden Word
interactiveExercises.scenario: Describe a colour without naming it.
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Ask the AI to describe the colour 'Red' without using the words 'Red', 'Blood', 'Apple', or 'Fire'.
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Describe the colour Red but do not use...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Describe the colour Red. Constraint: You must NOT use the words 'Red', 'Blood', 'Apple', or 'Fire'.

feedbackHints.forgotNegative: Did you tell the AI what NOT to use?
feedbackHints.perfect: Great use of negative constraints. This forces the AI to use associations like 'Sunset', 'Rose', or 'Danger'.

interactiveExercises.title: The Alphabet Game
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Write a prompt for a 5-word sentence where every word starts with the letter 'S'.
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a sentence exactly 5 words long where every single word starts with the letter S.

feedbackHints.tooLoose: Make sure you specify 'every single word'.

interactiveExercises.title: The Explain-Like-I-Am
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Explain 'The Internet' using only the 1,000 most common words in English.
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Explain how the internet works using only the 1,000 most common words in the English language.

feedbackHints.vague: Don't just say 'simple words'. Specify 'top 1000 most common words'. This is a known dataset for AI.
feedbackHints.perfect: This is similar to the famous 'Up Goer Five' challenge.

interactiveExercises.title: The Emoji Translator
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Ask the AI to summarise the plot of 'Romeo and Juliet' using ONLY emojis. No text allowed.
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Summarise the plot of Romeo and Juliet using ONLY emojis. Do not include any text or letters.

feedbackHints.allowedText: Make sure you explicitly ban text, otherwise the AI might explain the emojis.

interactiveExercises.title: The Keyword Stuffer
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Write a product description for a 'Smart Toaster'. It MUST include these exact phrases: 'Crunch Technology', 'Wifi Enabled', and 'Bread Data'.
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Write a description for a Smart Toaster including...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a product description for a Smart Toaster. You must include these three exact phrases naturally in the text: 'Crunch Technology', 'Wifi Enabled', and 'Bread Data'.

feedbackHints.missingPhrase: You need to list the exact phrases the AI must include.
feedbackHints.perfect: This technique is essential for marketing copy where specific brand terms are required.

interactiveExercises.title: The One-Syllable Challenge
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Ask the AI to write a motivational speech. Constraint: It can only use words with one syllable.
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Write a speech where every word...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a short motivational speech where every single word has only one syllable.

feedbackHints.vague: Be careful not to just say 'short words'. Say 'one syllable'.
feedbackHints.perfect: Go! Do it! Win! It works well.

interactiveExercises.title: The Rhyme Scheme
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Ask for a poem about 'Coding'. Constraint: It must follow the AABB rhyme scheme (couplets).
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Write a poem about coding with an...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a 4-line poem about computer coding. It must follow an AABB rhyme scheme.

feedbackHints.noScheme: Did you specify 'AABB'? Otherwise the AI might do ABAB or free verse.

interactiveExercises.title: The Dialogue Constraint
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Write a dialogue between two characters, Alice and Bob. Constraint: Alice can only ask questions. Bob can only answer 'Yes' or 'No'.
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Write a dialogue between Alice and Bob where...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a dialogue between Alice and Bob. Constraint: Alice is only allowed to ask questions. Bob is only allowed to answer 'Yes' or 'No'.

feedbackHints.tooLoose: Make sure you lock down BOTH characters' rules.
feedbackHints.perfect: This creates a very specific, tense interrogation dynamic.

interactiveExercises.title: The Genre Mashup
interactiveExercises.taskDescription: Write a story about a 'Haunted House'. Constraint: It must be written in the style of a 'Scientific Lab Report'.
interactiveExercises.starterTemplate: Write a story about a haunted house in the style of...
interactiveExercises.modelAnswer: Write a story about investigating a haunted house, but write it in the exact style and format of a scientific lab report. Use headers like 'Hypothesis', 'Methodology', and 'Spectral Observations'.

feedbackHints.styleMissing: The key is the clash between the topic (ghosts) and the style (science).
feedbackHints.perfect: Subject: Ectoplasm. Status: Viscous. Conclusion: Run.
